contentrichtext.text: {{Multiple issues |primary sources = December 2010 |refimprove = December 2010 |no footnotes = December 2010 }} {{Infobox Belgium Municipality |name=Nazareth |picture= |picture-legend= |map=GemNazarethLocation.png |map-legend=Location of Nazareth in East Flanders |arms=Schild23.gif |flag= |region={{BE-REG-FLE}} |community={{BE-NL}} |province={{BE-PROV-OV}} |arrondissement=[[Arrondissement of Ghent|Ghent]] |nis=44048 |pyramid-date= |0-19= |20-64= |65= |foreigners= |foreigners-date= |mayor=Danny Claeys {{Citation needed|date=December 2010}} |majority=[[Christen-Democratisch en Vlaams|CD&V]] {{Citation needed|date=December 2010}} |postal-codes=9810 |telephone-area=09 |web=[http://www.nazareth.be/ www.nazareth.be] |lat_deg=50 |lat_min=58 |lon_deg=03 |lon_min=36 }} == General information== '''Nazareth''' is a [[municipality]] located in the [[Belgium|Belgian]] province of [[East Flanders]]. The municipality comprises the towns of [[Eke, Belgium|Eke]] and Nazareth proper. On January 1, 2011 Nazareth had a total population of 11,252.{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}} The total area is 35.19 km²{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}} which gives a [[population density]] of 320 inhabitants per km². == History == The community was first recorded in 1259.{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}} == Etymology == There are various hypotheses for the origin of the name ''Nazareth''{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}}, dated to a text of songs from 1259 CE.{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}} It is possible that Nazareth was named after the biblical city of [[Nazareth]].{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}} It is also possible, but less likely, that Nazareth was originally a slip of the word ''magherhet'' (thinness).{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}} == Heraldry == The [[heraldry|arms]] of Nazareth is a composition of two family crests{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}}: ::The first part is the arms of the family Rockolfing{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}}: three gold roses geknopt throat in the field, vert scrolled head and a shield charged with a throat depth and looking round lion of gold, tongued gules{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}}. ::The second part is the escutcheon of the family Kervyn Volkaersbeke{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}}: saber in a twill together right in the head by an acorn, stemmed and browsed in two pieces, left in the mind of a six-pointed star, everything from gold and the one point eagle leg of silver{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}}. == Sightseeing == *A 19th-century church (1861 – 1870){{Citation needed|date=December 2010}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.nazareth.be Official website ] {{nl icon}} {{East Flanders}} [[Category:Municipalities of East Flanders]] {{EastFlanders-geo-stub}}
